intro: Macrolepis, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that typically range in color from white to yellow. The plants are native to southern Africa and are often found in grasslands and rocky habitats. Macrolepis species are herbaceous perennials that produce small, linear leaves and have a compact growth habit. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
